confession.seduction_context: When she had no bread and no money with which to buy any

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her daughters caused damage picking apples

witnesses.name: Dieudonne Galand
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Had illicit relationship resulting in child

testimony.quarrel_subject: He said she kept her trial documents in a chest at home; she overheard and was annoyed
Her son caught Zabel trying to enter maire Claudon Chadat's garden and struck her
Found Zabel's daughter collecting nuts under her nut tree and scolded her

harms_alleged.harm_description: knee trouble - couldn't support herself on it

testimony.quarrel_subject: His sister Catherine refused to safeguard Zabel's possessions from soldiers
Dispute over apples being sold - she didn't give full number, argument ensued
testimony.threat_quote: she became angry and threatened him

witnesses.name: Jean Masson
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Son of Barbey veuve Demenge Masson (witness 4)

testimony.quarrel_subject: He caught her trying to enter maire's garden and struck her

witnesses.name: Thiebauld Vicaire
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Son of victim, brother of Catherine

harms_alleged.harm_description: became ill on top of head and died within a few days
bad leg which lasted some 6 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: He told discharged soldiers that Zabel provided sexual favors despite her age, which angered her

harms_alleged.harm_description: could not yet walk or speak

testimony.quarrel_subject: Zabel asked her husband to buy her share in the 'glandée' (acorn harvest) of village woods; he refused
She refused to safeguard Zabel's possessions from soldiers
testimony.threat_quote: Her uncle and brothers threatened to have Zabel burned if she didn't heal her

testimony.quarrel_subject: She refused to allow one of Zabel's daughters to hold her baby

timeline.subject: Zabel du Sambois
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires contre Zabel de Sambois

timeline.subject: Zabel du Sambois
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; she maintained innocence

timeline.subject: Zabel du Sambois
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves execution, subject to repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Zabel du Sambois
timeline.details: Zabel confirms confessions, although partly withdrawing charges against Jean Waré and Babey Masson

timeline.subject: Zabel du Sambois
timeline.details: Note that execution has taken place

accomplices_named.name: la Pelisonnatte
accomplices_named.context: Accused had been denounced by her as accomplice; Pelisonnatte later withdrew accusation before execution. Zabel saw her at sabbat under torture confession

accomplices_named.name: Jean Waré
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as seen at sabbat; Zabel later partly withdrew this, saying she saw him going in front of her but didn't see him do any harm

accomplices_named.name: Babey Masson
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as seen at sabbat; judges suggested she was accusing her out of hatred. Zabel later partly withdrew this

prior_accusations.context: Had accused Zabel of being her accomplice, then withdrew the charge just before her execution at St. Dié. Zabel had written testimony of discharge

notable_quotes.speaker: Pairson Grand Jean
notable_quotes.french: se gardent de choser et quereller contre elle
notable_quotes.english: take care not to quarrel with her

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonne Galand
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ladite detenue gardoit son proces en ung coffre à sa maison
notable_quotes.english: that she the said prisoner kept her trial documents in a chest at her house
notable_quotes.context: Remark that angered Zabel and preceded his fall from pear tree

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonne Galand
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne scavoit ce qu'il vouloit faire, parce que son plus proche voisin, n'y vouloit venir s'elle y estoit, veu la mauvaise renommée qu'elle at, et la crainte que l'on avoit d'elle
notable_quotes.english: that he didn't know what he would do, because his nearest neighbor wouldn't come if she was there, given the bad reputation she had, and the fear people had of her
notable_quotes.context: Refusing to let Zabel join the winter evening circle (craigne)

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois (to Galand)
notable_quotes.french: elle le pria à joinctes mains, de l'y laisser aller et qu'il ne la crainds pas de ce qu'on disoit, et qu'elle deviendroit meilleur qu'elle ne fut oncques
notable_quotes.english: she begged him with joined hands to let her go there and that he shouldn't fear her because of what people said, and that she would become better than she had ever been
notable_quotes.context: Begging to be allowed to join the winter evening circle

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois (to Galand)
notable_quotes.french: il valloit mieulx qu'il espargnat son bien sans l'employer à l'entour d'elle
notable_quotes.english: it was better for him to save his property without spending it on her
notable_quotes.context: When Galand threatened to have her arrested over his horse's death

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Masson
notable_quotes.french: communement notée de sorcerie et paillardise
notable_quotes.english: commonly noted for witchcraft and sexual promiscuity

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Curien
notable_quotes.french: il leur enseigna la maison de ladicte detenue, comme celle qui quelquefois nonobstant sa viellesse, secouroit les bons compaignons de ses faveurs et amitiés
notable_quotes.english: he showed them the house of the said prisoner, as one who sometimes despite her age, helped the good companions with her favors and friendship
notable_quotes.context: Soldier telling discharged comrades that Zabel provided sexual services

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme Didier Claude Phle
notable_quotes.french: et des qu'elle fut accusée par la precedente executée estre de ses complices, on ne s'a fié à elle, mais l'at on tousjours crainct en estime de sorciere
notable_quotes.english: and as soon as she was accused by the previously executed woman of being her accomplice, no one trusted her, but always feared her as a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe femme Jean Chadat
notable_quotes.french: une sorciere et une femme qui ne vaut rien
notable_quotes.english: a witch and a woman who is worth nothing

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: soubz espoir d'estre secourue et aydée en sa pauvreté, elle obeyt au maire Claudon Chadat dudit Mouriviller de tant qu'elle procrea ung enffant de ses oeuvres
notable_quotes.english: in hope of being helped and aided in her poverty, she obeyed maire Claudon Chadat of said Mouriviller to the extent that she conceived a child by him
notable_quotes.context: Explaining her illicit relationship with the maire during widowhood

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: que peut estre dieu luy avoit envoyé ce mal, affin de faire avoir souvenance de son pere qui peult estre estoit detenu en quelques peines, et demandoit certaines prieres et suffrages, pour estre delivré desdites peines
notable_quotes.english: that perhaps God had sent her this illness, in order to remind her of her father who might be detained in some pains, and demanded certain prayers and intercessions, to be delivered from said pains
notable_quotes.context: Her explanation of prayer by Catherine's bedside

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: que c'est ung langard auquel il ne fault adjouster beaucoup de foid
notable_quotes.english: that he is a liar who should not be given much credence
notable_quotes.context: Defending herself against maire Galand's testimony

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: les pauvres doibvent plier pour les riches
notable_quotes.english: the poor must bend for the rich
notable_quotes.context: What the curé told her about apologizing to maire Galand

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: que ce sont touttes choses qu'on luy impose faulsement et a grand tort, le tout par envie et malveillance et qu'on fait tousjours ainsi contre les pauvres gens
notable_quotes.english: that these are all things falsely imposed on her and very wrongly, all through envy and malice and that this is always done against poor people

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: une grande bourdiere et une grande babillarde
notable_quotes.english: a great liar and a great talker

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.french: munie du Saint Sacrement de Confirmation, et at ouy dire aux vielles gens Que celles qui sont ainsy confirmées ne peuvent estre sorcieres
notable_quotes.english: received the Holy Sacrament of Confirmation, and have heard old people say that those who are thus confirmed cannot be witches

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois (to Jeannon)
notable_quotes.french: Qu'elle garde son ame, et qu'elle ne la charge ainsy à grand tort
notable_quotes.english: That she guard her soul, and not burden it thus so wrongly
notable_quotes.context: Calling out to witness as she left confrontation

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel du Sambois
notable_quotes.english: You are incurring a great burden
notable_quotes.context: Telling judges they would not reach Paradise for torturing her wrongly

relationships.evidence_text: Married to Mengin le Parmentier de Sambois, widow for 18 years
she obeyed maire Claudon Chadat to the extent that she conceived a child by him
her son (who was not yet married)

economic_context.details: Zabel was poor, widowed for 18 years. Had illicit relationship with maire Galand 'in hope of being helped and aided in her poverty.' Multiple disputes over gleaning rights, apple picking, nut gathering by her daughters. Conflict over acorn harvest rights in village woods. She and her daughters appeared to be surviving through foraging and market trade.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Her daughters caused damage picking apples

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell out of a fruit tree (pear) and landed on his head
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He said she kept her trial documents in a chest; she overheard and was annoyed
His daughters refused to give pears and cheese to Zabel's daughters; Zabel met his servant leading horses to pasture and said he would be reproached

harms_catalog.victim_name: son of Barbey veuve Demenge Masson
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill and remained so for 3 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He caught her trying to get into maire's garden, gave chase and struck her

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Jeannon femme Jean Gerardat
harms_catalog.harm_description: knee trouble - couldn't support herself on it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Found Zabel's daughter collecting nuts under her nut tree and scolded her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured by 'estuve' with cheese recommended by Zabel

harms_catalog.harm_description: painful leg, forced to take to bed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine refused to safeguard Zabel's possessions from soldiers
harms_catalog.method_alleged: healed after Zabel prayed and placed candles in church; knee was lanced

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill on top of head and died within a few days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had quarrelled with her and her daughters

harms_catalog.harm_description: bad leg which lasted some 6 weeks

harms_catalog.victim_name: 4 year old child of Colas Curien
harms_catalog.harm_description: could not yet walk or speak, although had begun to walk at one stage
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He told discharged soldiers that Zabel provided sexual services despite her age
Horse had strayed onto Zabel's land; she reproached him

harms_catalog.victim_name: pig of Georgeatte and Didier Claude Phle
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, after three weeks had to be killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Zabel asked husband to buy her share in the 'glandée' of village woods; he refused

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Idatte femme Jean Claude Phle
harms_catalog.harm_description: became lame in one leg around age of one, still was at time of trial
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She refused to allow one of Zabel's daughters to hold her baby

material_culture.context: Zabel's daughters picking apples; Zabel taking apples to market
Zabel's daughters asked for pears from Galand's daughters
Zabel's daughters asked for cheese; used in remedy for knee trouble
Where Zabel allegedly kept her trial documents
Zabel's daughter collecting nuts under witness's nut tree
Ends of wax candles placed on chandelier in church by Zabel
Zabel taking to market at Gerbeviller
Used to cause harm in confession
Seven roots used in healing remedy
Handful recommended as part of remedy for child's illness
Pull hard on them as part of remedy

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Market town where Zabel sold apples; residence of witness Demenge Buriat
Woods near Gerbeviller where acorn harvest took place
Home of maire Curien whose son's pigs were being kept
Where Zabel prayed for Catherine's healing and placed candles

spatial_references.place_name: garden behind house of maire Claudon Chadat
spatial_references.context: Where Zabel was caught trespassing by Jean Masson

historical_context.military_details: Soldiers came to village around last Ascensiontide (1592); Zabel's house was not exempt from lodging soldiers while others were. Colas Curien had served in ducal army and returned with discharged soldiers.
economic_hardship_indicators: Zabel's poverty - widow for 18 years, no bread or money
Illicit relationship with maire 'in hope of being helped in her poverty'
Foraging for survival - daughters picking apples, nuts
Disputes over gleaning rights and acorn harvest access

legal_context.redress_outcome: She had been publicly called a witch many times but never sought legal reparation

hearsay_chains.content: deaths of horses etc. attributed to her

emotional_state_notes: Before confrontations: said Benedicite, crossed herself, called on God, Virgin, and all saints
Said she was confirmed and confirmed people cannot be witches
Told judges they would not reach Paradise for torturing her wrongly
Called out to witness to guard her soul

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called him a liar who should not be given much credence (ung langard)
Called her 'a great liar and a great talker' (une grande bourdiere et une grande babillarde)
Cried out to her 'guard your soul and don't burden it so wrongly'

third_parties.name: Hidatte wife of Jean Claudon
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Asked to intervene on Zabel's behalf with Galand

third_parties.name: curé of Mouriviller
third_parties.context: Persuaded Zabel to apologize to maire Galand, telling her 'the poor must bend for the rich'; present at Easter reconciliation

third_parties.name: son of maire Curien of St. Hilaire
third_parties.context: Was with Demenge Buriat keeping pigs during quarrel with Zabel

third_parties.name: Babey widow of Demenge Masson
third_parties.context: Called in to treat Catherine Vicaire's leg; her ointment made it worse, then said it was 'mal donné' (given illness)

third_parties.name: Claudon Vicaire
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Father of Catherine; quarrelled with Zabel
third_parties.context: Lost an eye 5-6 years before; died Easter 1592 from head illness; Zabel confessed to killing him

third_parties.name: daughters of Zabel
third_parties.context: Involved in multiple quarrels (picking apples, collecting nuts); were ill and asked for pears and cheese; one refused to hold Idatte's baby

third_parties.name: child of Zabel and maire Galand
third_parties.context: Conceived during widowhood with maire Claudon Chadat (also called Galand); still living at time of trial

third_parties.name: daughters of Dieudonne Galand
third_parties.context: Refused to give pears and cheese to Zabel's daughters

third_parties.name: garson (servant) of Dieudonne Galand
third_parties.context: Was leading horses to pasture when Zabel warned him

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 17 witnesses providing extensive testimony about quarrels, threats, and alleged harms. Strong pattern of harm following quarrel. Zabel maintained innocence until torture, then confessed. Trial shows clear poverty and social marginalization of accused. Multiple references to her daughters being involved in foraging disputes. Notable defense claim about being confirmed in church and therefore unable to be witch. Prior accusation by 'la Pelisonnatte' (executed at St. Dié) was withdrawn but still influenced community perception. Economic desperation led to illicit relationship with maire that produced child.
